author: Odeinoichus
title: Eris Soars Across Dimensions.
review:
Set #71232 Legends of Chima Fun Pack Eris: This is the third and final Fun Pack released for this Theme and with it we see more of the impressive builds from the Chima line, as well as more character dialogue from Eris in-game which stands out as fun and funny.

Packaging

Eris’ image dominates the front of the box and she’s charged with CHI power to decimate the evil Lord Vortech. The rest of the packaging is standard from the Theme and very well put together.

Parts

Nothing rare to stand out here, but there is a nice small selection of parts with a few Studs with holes in for attaching items to and some nice dark blue sloped elements.

Minifigures

Eris: As with her companions before her, Eris is unique to the Dimensions line as far as her torso printing is involved. The detailing found commonly on Chima Minifigures is unique for her Fire Armor and she only shares the basic parts of past incarnations. Her accessory is a nice double-bladed axe-like thing of some kind and her Toy Tag is printed with unique markings for the character.

The build

Eagle Interceptor: This build is making a miniaturized version of the larger set, which I own… So yeah, this build was pretty sweet actually. Although I can attest that it is a bit on the flimsy side, numerous tumbles off my game shelf have resulted in parts popping off far too easily.

Eagle Skyblazer: This build changes the model fairly drastically, gone is the look of the original and in its place is a sleeker design with a more streamlined build that works pretty good as a final model.

Eagle Swoop Diver: This final build is not as impressive as the first two, however it does still come together fairly quickly and alters the overall design of the vehicle on the Toy Tag.

The completed model

Eagle Interceptor & Alternate Models: All three of these vehicles represent the Eagle Tribe, which is one of my all-time faves from the Legends of Chima waves. The original model is a small version of the larger set, it suffers from structural issues due to the nature of the build, but still captures the look quite nicely. The in-game model is slightly larger to fit Minifigures and the head is built differently, which is a bit of shame.

The first re-build looks pretty solid too with a streamlined design that makes it appear as if the model is charging rapidly through the sky at enemies. The third and final model is ok, but it does have an odd design choice with the tail sticking up to represent a large flame thrower or something. Not entirely sure how the thing is supposed to fly like that.

The Digital Content

The Adventure World: It’s another character that unlocks the Chima world. Nothing else really to say here, it’s the same vast world to explore as has been discussed in the other fun packs and includes all of the same puzzles.

Character & Vehicle Abilities: Eris has the ability to destroy Cracked LEGO Objects, collect and harness CHI can Target and Fly. The Eagle Interceptor is a flying vehicle with the power to interact with Flight Docks and Flight Cargo Hooks.

The second model adds the Speed Boost and Destroy Silver LEGO Objects abilities while the third model replaces both of those with Special Attack and Destroy Gold LEGO Objects while still maintaining the Flight Docks and Flight Cargo Hooks Abilities.

Overall opinion

Out of the three Fun Packs a lot of people, even myself, has recommended just getting Cragger, however as a huge fan of the Eagle tribe I also recommend picking up this set if you still can. The models in the set are pretty fun, even if they do cut corners on parts used compared to the digital models, and Eris is a flying character making her easier to use for one of the CHI puzzles in a high area of The Simpsons Adventure World. True you could just Hire-A-Hero, but where’s the fun in that?

Overall a fun set and one worth picking up. Recommended.
